intro: Cnidoscolus aconitifolius subsp. polyanthus, commonly known as the giant arrowhead or arrowleaf cupuaçu, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by edible, fleshy fruits. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as a vegetable in some regions. The plant thrives in humid, warm climates and is commonly found in rainforests and riverbanks.
